results.title: Bushed
results.brief_description: An animated story concerning a displaced First Nations person and an out-of-place kangaroo who meet and decide to go ‘bush’, only to discover that they are intruders on their own land. A satire of life as an Australian First Nations person during the resources boom of the 1970’s, “Bushed” explores problems faced by First Nations peoples seeking employment, the ethics of tourism, slaughtering of kangaroos for pet food, and European denial of prior ownership by First Nations. This program carries a strong environmental message of the impact of colonisation on our native fauna.

results.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Hal McElroy, Jim McElroy, Patricia Lovell and McElroy & McElroy
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1900 three girls from a private school and their teacher unaccountably vanish on a St Valentine’s Day school picnic to a mysterious rock in the midst of the Australian bush. The Victorian girls’ school for the daughters of the privileged gradually becomes contaminated and destroyed from within by its inability to understand the forces confronting it. Based on a novel which mythologises the emergence of sexuality, the film atmospherically follows various tangents without distilling a sense of explanation. Unease is evoked by the horror of not knowing. Based on the novel by Joan Lindsay. Cast includes Rachel Roberts, Dominic Guard, Helen Morse and Jacki Weaver.

results.title: Victoria's Energy
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Victoria’s energy” uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

See also Related Title “Energy conservation in the home” which provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

results.title: Living with forests
results.creator_credit: Ian Toohill, Stephen Skok and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Living with forests: The future of Leadbeater’s forest is the subject of a local enquiry. The viewer is asked to imagine that you are a member of the local community and give your views.

results.title: Malcolm McKinnon: 6 films for MAP at ACMI
results.brief_description: A collection of six short documentary films from an ongoing project between the filmmaker, Malcolm McKinnon, and small museums in the Wimmera farming region of Victoria. They comprise of local stories told by local people from such areas as Warracknabeal, Rainbow, Murtoa, Brim and Coromby.

group_works.title: Disappeared racecourses of north west Victoria

results.title: Stories and songs of the people: they came for gathering
results.creator_credit: Fiona Cochrane, Johnnie Aseron, ABC-TV (Australia). Indigenous Program Unit, f-reel and Indigenous Unit, AFC
results.brief_description: This video documents the first ‘Stories and songs of the people’ event held in Australia at the Forum theatre, Melbourne in 1999. This event was organised by “grass roots” community and gave the opportunity for many artists to express a collective future through music. It’s aim was to create a cultural and educational exchange with other First Nations groups from around the globe. bearing in mind similarities which exist between some Indigenous peoples, eg American and Australian First Nations colonisation and dispossession, their traditional links to the land and the loss of their identity. Music is seen as a healing process towards reconciliation. Performing artists include Frankie Yamma, Peter Rotumah, Deb Morrow, Kelli Howell, Neil Murray & Stephen Teakle, Shane Howard, Illana Atkinson, Tom E. Lewis, Tiffany Eckardt & Dave Steel, Nick larkins, Lee Morgan, Russell Smith, Malcolm Jagamuarra and visiting Native American artist Johnnie Aseron. Video support notes included.

results.title: Cherish
results.creator_credit: Stephen Jones, AFTRS and Romaine Moreton
results.brief_description:
“What peace is there for us whose best love cannot return them even for a day? …..The last word was yours.” (Jeannette Winterson ‘Written on the Body’)
A poetic and tender story celebrating life, love and death.
Cast: John Adam, Russell Page

results.title: The Cup and the lip
results.creator_credit: Bruno de Villenoisy, Joanna Robinski and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A difficult child and a good mother. A loose tooth, a sign on a wall, an imaginary word, ecstasy, anger… A disturbing film about the ultimate taboo.
Cast: Gosia Dobrowolska, Julian Barta
